intro: Stachys heraclea, commonly known as hedge nettle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with purple petals, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough, serrated edge, while the plant is known for its stinging hairs that can cause skin irritation. Stachys heraclea is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in moist, temperate environments.
